author: James Joyce
text: Dear Kathleen: I have received your letter from which I gather you want, or rather your mother wants, me to write in the first instance to my friend Mr Curran in Dublin. He is due back in Dublin, I understand, on Thursday, 1st October. I shall therefore write to him fully on Sunday, 3rd October, unless I hear from you meanwhile that this is not what you want me to do. I hope you can read my handwriting Best greetings to you both Jim
